definition: to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: Now, the second point, Captain Cuttle.
sentences.chinese: 现在讲第二点，卡特尔船长。

sentences.english: 'What did you say, Captain Cuttle?' inquired Walter.
sentences.chinese: “您说什么，卡特尔船长？”沃尔特问道。

sentences.english: All this, so that the people know that the cartels are to be feared.
sentences.chinese: 所有这一切都是要让民众知道卡特尔的可怕。

sentences.english: Araceli, however, has received threat letters signed by Los Zetas, another cartel.
sentences.chinese: 然而婀瑞思利收到过另一个卡特尔洛齐塔的恐吓信。

sentences.english: 'I shouldn't wonder, Captain Cuttle, ' returned the boy.
sentences.chinese: “我对这不会奇怪，卡特尔船长，”孩子回答道。

sentences.english: The Commission started the cartel investigation on its own initiative following a tip-off from an anonymous source.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟委员会根据一份匿名举报主动提起卡特尔调查。

sentences.english: It is generally believed that cartel is of the most anti-competitive practice.
sentences.chinese: 卡特尔被普遍认为是所有反竞争行为中危害最大的。

sentences.english: Cartel was an important collusive way of firms in the oligopoly market.
sentences.chinese: 卡特尔是寡头垄断市场中厂商的一种重要勾结形式。

definition: O'Connor (name)/Thomas Power O'Connor (1848-1929), Irish journalist and nationalist political leader
nations of the Persian Gulf/Gulf states
Werther, opera by Jules Massenet/Werther, German masculine given name
Essen, city in the Ruhr 魯爾區|鲁尔区[Lu3 er3 Qu1], Germany
Burns (name)/Nicholas Burns (1956-), US diplomat, Under-secretary at US State Department from 2005
Franco (name)/Generalissimo Francisco Franco Bahamonde (1892-1975), Spanish dictator and head of state 1939-1975
Milton (name)/John Milton (1608-1674), English republican writer and poet, author of Paradise Lost
